snippet: Attacks on Steve Jobs began on Twitter, blogs and Web sites as quickly as the mythmaking about him had.
abstract: Spate of glowing obituaries that appeared moments after Steve Jobs's death have been quickly replaced by attacks on the Apple founder, as critics use Facebook and Twitter as a platform to sound off.

snippet: Apple confirmed software bugs are hurting battery life on the iPhone 4S. It also said the software bugs are in iOS 5, a new version of Apple's operating system that also runs older models of the iPhone and the iPad. It thinks it can fix the proble...
abstract: Apple confirmed software bugs are hurting battery life on the iPhone 4S. It also said the software bugs are in iOS 5, a new version of Apple's operating system that also runs older models of the iPhone and the iPad. It thinks it can fix the problem with a software upgrade.

headline.main: Apple Admits Software Bugs Hurting Battery Life in iPhone

snippet: Apple confirmed software bugs are hurting battery life on the iPhone 4S. It also said the software bugs are in iOS 5, a new version of Apple's operating system that also runs older models of the iPhone and the iPad. It thinks it can fix the proble...
abstract: Apple confirmed software bugs are hurting battery life on the iPhone 4S. It also said the software bugs are in iOS 5, a new version of Apple's operating system that also runs older models of the iPhone and the iPad. It thinks it can fix the problem with a software upgrade.

headline.main: Apple Admits Software Bugs Hurting Battery Life in iPhone

snippet: With an infusion of new blood, once-sleepy South SoHo may be reviving the shopping district’s appeal.
abstract: South SoHo is becoming trendy again as several new fashion and design boutiques open, shaking up the sleepy streets of the downtown Manhattan neighborhood.

headline.main: South SoHo, Hip’s Home on the Fringe

snippet: With thousands of games available, it’s difficult to find just the right fun. So experts were asked for advice when choosing apps.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column presents mobile game favorites of gaming enthusiasts and developers.

headline.main: Mobile Game Favorites of the Experts, of All Ages
headline.print_headline: Mobile Game Favorites of the Experts, of All Ages

snippet: No foundering Internet giant has ever recovered. Will Yahoo go the way of AOL and MySpace?
abstract: No foundering Internet giant has ever recovered. Will Yahoo go the way of AOL and MySpace?

abstract: Creating patient information resources about cancer.

snippet: The Japanese electronics and entertainment giant said that it expected to post a net loss for the full year, hurt by the strong yen, floods in Thailand and weak overseas sales.
abstract: Sony reports loss of 27 billion yen in quarter ended Sept. 30, compared with profit of 31.1 billion yen in year-ago quarter; revenue was 1.58 trillion yen, down 9 percent; expects loss for year ending March 2012 of 90 billion yen, or $1.2 billion.

headline.main: Mounting Woes Prompt Sony to Predict Another Annual Loss
headline.print_headline: Flooding, Strong Yen and Poor Sales Lead Sony to Predict a Loss

snippet: A new wave of butcher shops has opened. To make the most of them, a basic understanding of the cuts of meat helps.
abstract: New wave of butcher shops have opened in New York and consumers will be best served if they have a basic understanding of the cut of meats; recipes for lamb, pork belly and veal shanks offered.

headline.main: The Lost Art of Buying From a Butcher
